member.name: T:System.Console
member.summary: Represents the standard input, output, and error streams for console applications. This class cannot be inherited.To browse the .NET Framework source code for this type, see the Reference Source.

member.name: P:System.Console.BackgroundColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the background color of the console.
member.returns: A value that specifies the background color of the console; that is, the color that appears behind each character. The default is black.
member.exception: The color specified in a set operation is not a valid member of .
The user does not have permission to perform this action.

member.name: E:System.Console.CancelKeyPress
member.summary: Occurs when the modifier key (Ctrl) and either the console key (C) or the Break key are pressed simultaneously (Ctrl+C or Ctrl+Break).

member.name: P:System.Console.Error
member.summary: Gets the standard error output stream.
member.returns: A that represents the standard error output stream.

member.name: P:System.Console.ForegroundColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the foreground color of the console.
member.returns: A that specifies the foreground color of the console; that is, the color of each character that is displayed. The default is gray.
member.exception: The color specified in a set operation is not a valid member of .
The user does not have permission to perform this action.

member.name: P:System.Console.In
member.summary: Gets the standard input stream.
member.returns: A that represents the standard input stream.

member.name: M:System.Console.OpenStandardError
member.summary: Acquires the standard error stream.

member.name: M:System.Console.OpenStandardInput
member.summary: Acquires the standard input stream.

member.name: M:System.Console.OpenStandardOutput
member.summary: Acquires the standard output stream.

member.name: P:System.Console.Out
member.summary: Gets the standard output stream.
member.returns: A that represents the standard output stream.

member.name: M:System.Console.Read
member.summary: Reads the next character from the standard input stream.
member.returns: The next character from the input stream, or negative one (-1) if there are currently no more characters to be read.

member.name: M:System.Console.ReadLine
member.summary: Reads the next line of characters from the standard input stream.
member.returns: The next line of characters from the input stream, or null if no more lines are available.
member.exception: There is insufficient memory to allocate a buffer for the returned string.
The number of characters in the next line of characters is greater than .

member.name: M:System.Console.ResetColor
member.summary: Sets the foreground and background console colors to their defaults.
member.exception: The user does not have permission to perform this action.

member.name: M:System.Console.SetError(System.IO.TextWriter)
member.summary: Sets the property to the specified object.
member.param: A stream that is the new standard error output.
member.exception: The caller does not have the required permission.

member.name: M:System.Console.SetIn(System.IO.TextReader)
member.summary: Sets the property to the specified object.
member.param: A stream that is the new standard input.
member.exception: The caller does not have the required permission.

member.name: M:System.Console.SetOut(System.IO.TextWriter)
member.summary: Sets the property to the specified object.
member.param: A stream that is the new standard output.
member.exception: The caller does not have the required permission.

member.name: M:System.Console.Write(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Writes the text representation of the specified Boolean value to the standard output stream.

member.name: M:System.Console.Write(System.Char)
member.summary: Writes the specified Unicode character value to the standard output stream.

member.name: M:System.Console.Write(System.Char[])
member.summary: Writes the specified array of Unicode characters to the standard output stream.

member.name: M:System.Console.Write(System.Char[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Writes the specified subarray of Unicode characters to the standard output stream.
member.param: The number of characters to write.
member.exception: plus specify a position that is not within .

member.name: M:System.Console.Write(System.Decimal)
member.summary: Writes the text representation of the specified value to the standard output stream.

member.name: M:System.Console.Write(System.Double)
member.summary: Writes the text representation of the specified double-precision floating-point value to the standard output stream.

member.name: M:System.Console.Write(System.Int32)
member.summary: Writes the text representation of the specified 32-bit signed integer value to the standard output stream.

member.name: M:System.Console.Write(System.Int64)
member.summary: Writes the text representation of the specified 64-bit signed integer value to the standard output stream.

member.name: M:System.Console.Write(System.Object)
member.summary: Writes the text representation of the specified object to the standard output stream.
member.param: The value to write, or null.

member.name: M:System.Console.Write(System.Single)
member.summary: Writes the text representation of the specified single-precision floating-point value to the standard output stream.

member.name: M:System.Console.Write(System.String)
member.summary: Writes the specified string value to the standard output stream.

member.name: M:System.Console.Write(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Writes the text representation of the specified object to the standard output stream using the specified format information.
member.exception: The format specification in is invalid.

member.name: M:System.Console.Write(System.String,System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Writes the text representation of the specified objects to the standard output stream using the specified format information.
member.param: The first object to write using .
The second object to write using .
member.exception: The format specification in is invalid.

member.name: M:System.Console.Write(System.String,System.Object,System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Writes the text representation of the specified objects to the standard output stream using the specified format information.
member.param: The first object to write using .
The second object to write using .
The third object to write using .
member.exception: The format specification in is invalid.

member.name: M:System.Console.Write(System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Writes the text representation of the specified array of objects to the standard output stream using the specified format information.
member.param: An array of objects to write using .
member.exception: The format specification in is invalid.

member.name: M:System.Console.Write(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Writes the text representation of the specified 32-bit unsigned integer value to the standard output stream.

member.name: M:System.Console.Write(System.UInt64)
member.summary: Writes the text representation of the specified 64-bit unsigned integer value to the standard output stream.

member.name: M:System.Console.WriteLine
member.summary: Writes the current line terminator to the standard output stream.

member.summary: Writes the text representation of the specified Boolean value, followed by the current line terminator, to the standard output stream.

member.name: M:System.Console.WriteLine(System.Char[])

member.name: T:System.ConsoleCancelEventArgs
member.summary: Provides data for the event. This class cannot be inherited.

member.name: P:System.ConsoleCancelEventArgs.Cancel
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether simultaneously pressing the modifier key and the console key (Ctrl+C) or the Ctrl+Break keys terminates the current process. The default is false, which terminates the current process.
member.returns: true if the current process should resume when the event handler concludes; false if the current process should terminate. The default value is false; the current process terminates when the event handler returns. If true, the current process continues.

member.name: P:System.ConsoleCancelEventArgs.SpecialKey
member.summary: Gets the combination of modifier and console keys that interrupted the current process.
member.returns: One of the enumeration values that specifies the key combination that interrupted the current process. There is no default value.

member.name: T:System.ConsoleCancelEventHandler
member.summary: Represents the method that will handle the event of a .
member.param: A object that contains the event data.

member.name: T:System.ConsoleColor
member.summary: Specifies constants that define foreground and background colors for the console.

member.summary: The color black.

member.summary: The color blue.

member.summary: The color dark cyan (dark blue-green).

member.summary: The color white.

member.name: F:System.ConsoleColor.Yellow

member.name: T:System.ConsoleSpecialKey
member.summary: Specifies combinations of modifier and console keys that can interrupt the current process.

member.name: F:System.ConsoleSpecialKey.ControlBreak
member.summary: The modifier key plus the BREAK console key.

member.name: F:System.ConsoleSpecialKey.ControlC
member.summary: The modifier key plus the console key.
